intro: Myrcia paracatuensis var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf myrcia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Brazil, particularly found in the states of Minas Gerais and Espírito Santo. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. The plant is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
